about_the_game:
Inspired by similar works in loop scenarios

This time, you're trapped in a Japanese convenience store, and it´s nighttime! The difficulty has been raised—find every anomaly and escape through the correct door.

The game relies on detailed visual observation, so unfamiliar language won´t hinder your experience.

There are dozens of anomalies, along with a few jump scares, creating a slightly eerie atmosphere.

But don´t worry about the abundance of items in the convenience store. We have balanced the game´s difficulty to some extent—this is not an extremely hardcore spot-the-difference game.

You also don´t need to worry too much about the jump scare elements. This isn´t a game focused on heavy horror. The few mild jump scares are mainly added to enhance the fun.

The only advice is to keep a strong impression of Scene Zero.

To maintain a consistent difficulty level, we’ve disabled adjustments to brightness, FOV, and other visual settings in the game. Only basic settings like resolution and fullscreen/windowed modes are available. While you can adjust your monitor settings, it’s highly discouraged as it may impact the intended game experience.

Playtime:

The game duration heavily depends on your observational skills—you might finish in just a few minutes, or perhaps never escape...
